claims.object: Process of designing a software application so that it can be adapted to various languages, regional peculiarities and technical requirements of a target locale.
Means of adapting to different languages, regional peculiarities and technical requirements of a target locale

surface_layer.definition: The process of designing a software application so that it can be adapted to various languages, regional peculiarities and technical requirements of a target locale.

deep_layer.mechanism: Involves designing software with consideration for future adaptation, often through externalization of text and other locale-specific elements.
deep_layer.origin: Emerged with the growth of global software markets.

examples: A software application that can display text in English, Spanish, and French.
